A **hill giant**, H, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The hill giant is a [giant humanoid](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid") that has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") and can be seen via infravision. Like all living [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(monster_attribute\) "Giant (monster attribute)"), they will seek out [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems") and other items to pick up and can move over [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder"), pick them up and throw them.

A hill giant has a single weapon attack.

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a hill giant [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of increasing a character's [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The attacks of hill giants and other sufficiently large monsters can inflict knockback, sending targets flying one or more squares.

Hill giants and other large humanoids can wear mummy wrappings.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Hill giants may generate as peaceful towards chaotic characters, and can generate in small [groups](/wiki/Groups "Groups") of two to four.

Hill giants may appear among the hostile giant humanoids generated in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") at dungeon levels 13 and below, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The hill giant is the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster for [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople"), and makes up 24⁄175 (\~13.71%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [Caveman quest](/wiki/Caveman_quest "Caveman quest"). Several hill giants are also generated on level creation for quest floors between the home and goal level: one on the upper filler level, eight on the locate level, and two each on the lower filler level(s). Hill giants may also appear among the random H that are part of the second quest monster class for the Caveman quest, and make up 6⁄175 (\~3.42%) of the monsters that are randomly generated there. Hill giants may additionally appear among the random H that are part of the second quest monster class for [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie"), and make up 6⁄175 (\~3.42%) of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest").

A peaceful hill giant is generated asleep and imprisoned within the [Dark One](/wiki/Dark_One "Dark One")'s dungeon on the goal level of the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest").

Hill giants have a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") either a boulder or a [club](/wiki/Club "Club") with equal probability, and an independent chance of being generated with a small assortment of gems.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) They are eligible for [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"), and [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item").

## Strategy

Hill giants are somewhat slow at 10 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") and have the weakest weapon attack among giant humanoids as well as the weakest [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") (tied with the [minotaur](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur") at 6) - though they are not especially dangerous compared to other giants, hill giants can still pose a threat if they obtain a dangerous [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand"). Hill giants are generally easy to hit in melee for the point they are encountered, though they can wear non-torso armor; they are also especially vulnerable to wands and [spells](/wiki/Spell "Spell") themselves, due to lacking any [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)").

Hill giants provide an ample opportunity for Cavemen and Valkyries to improve their [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") during their quest; Cavemen also have a co-aligned sanctuary and can use the giants' boulders to fill the inconveniently-placed [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit") traps.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Knockback can make hill giants and other large monsters exceedingly dangerous if the player character is positioned between them and a hazard, such as [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") of water or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava").

## History

The hill giant first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), hill giants may appear among the random H generated in [giant courts](/wiki/Giant_court "Giant court") and the [Giant Caverns](/wiki/Giant_Caverns "Giant Caverns"), but will not randomly generate in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

A peaceful hill giant is generated asleep and imprisoned within [Maugneshaagar](/wiki/Maugneshaagar "Maugneshaagar")'s dungeon on the goal level of the [Necromancer quest](/wiki/Necromancer_quest "Necromancer quest"), which is near-identical to that of the Wizard quest.

All of the above information also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), hill giants are neutral-aligned and vulnerable to [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"). They have an additional 1⁄4 chance of being generated with a club, due to an oversight in the code.

Hill giants may appear among the court of a [titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan")-ruled [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room").

The revamped [Healer quest](/index.php?title=Healer_quest/dNetHack\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Healer quest/dNetHack (page does not exist)") has hill giants that can be generated on several of the floors at level creation: one hill giant has a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of generating on the home level; two hill giants can generate on the upper filler level, with one having a 3⁄4 chance (75%) and the other having a 1⁄4 chance (25%); one hill giant is always generated on the locate level, with a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of a second being generated; one hill giant is always generated on each of the lower filler levels, with two more that each have a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of being generated; and three hill giants are always generated on the goal level. Hill giants generated on the standard Healer quest floors are always generated with a [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack") special-cased to contain various live victims of a plague that the [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer") is sent to cure during the quest.

## Encyclopedia entry

Giants have always walked the earth, though they are rare in these times. They range in size from little over nine feet to a towering twenty feet or more. The larger ones use huge boulders as weapons, hurling them over large distances. All types of giants share a love for men - roasted, boiled, or fried. Their table manners are legendary.

## References

A hill giant has a single weapon attack.

Eating a hill giant corpse or tin has a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of increasing a character's strength.

The attacks of hill giants and other sufficiently large monsters can inflict knockback, sending targets flying one or more squares.

Generation

Hill giants may generate as peaceful towards chaotic characters, and can generate in small groups of two to four.

Hill giants may appear among the hostile giant humanoids generated in throne rooms at dungeon levels 13 and below, and can also appear among the monsters randomly generated by looting a throne while confused and carrying gold (provided there is no chest on the level).[1]

The hill giant is the second quest monster for Cavepeople, and makes up 24⁄175 (~13.71%) of the monsters randomly generated on the Caveman quest. Several hill giants are also generated on level creation for quest floors between the home and goal level: one on the upper filler level, eight on the locate level, and two each on the lower filler level(s). Hill giants may also appear among the random H that are part of the second quest monster class for the Caveman quest, and make up 6⁄175 (~3.42%) of the monsters that are randomly generated there. Hill giants may additionally appear among the random H that are part of the second quest monster class for Valkyries, and make up 6⁄175 (~3.42%) of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Valkyrie quest.

A peaceful hill giant is generated asleep and imprisoned within the Dark One's dungeon on the goal level of the Wizard quest.

Hill giants have a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of being generated with either a boulder or a club with equal probability, and an independent chance of being generated with a small assortment of gems.[2][3] They are eligible for offensive items, defensive items, and miscellaneous items.

Strategy

Hill giants are somewhat slow at 10 speed and have the weakest weapon attack among giant humanoids as well as the weakest AC (tied with the minotaur at 6) - though they are not especially dangerous compared to other giants, hill giants can still pose a threat if they obtain a dangerous wand. Hill giants are generally easy to hit in melee for the point they are encountered, though they can wear non-torso armor; they are also especially vulnerable to wands and spells themselves, due to lacking any MR score.

Hill giants provide an ample opportunity for Cavemen and Valkyries to improve their strength during their quest; Cavemen also have a co-aligned sanctuary and can use the giants' boulders to fill the inconveniently-placed pit traps.

Knockback can make hill giants and other large monsters exceedingly dangerous if the player character is positioned between them and a hazard, such as pools of water or lava.

History

The hill giant first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, hill giants may appear among the random H generated in giant courts and the Giant Caverns, but will not randomly generate in Gehennom.

A peaceful hill giant is generated asleep and imprisoned within Maugneshaagar's dungeon on the goal level of the Necromancer quest, which is near-identical to that of the Wizard quest.

All of the above information also applies to SlashTHEM and Hack'EM.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, hill giants are neutral-aligned and vulnerable to iron. They have an additional 1⁄4 chance of being generated with a club, due to an oversight in the code.

Hill giants may appear among the court of a titan-ruled throne room.

The revamped Healer quest has hill giants that can be generated on several of the floors at level creation: one hill giant has a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of generating on the home level; two hill giants can generate on the upper filler level, with one having a 3⁄4 chance (75%) and the other having a 1⁄4 chance (25%); one hill giant is always generated on the locate level, with a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of a second being generated; one hill giant is always generated on each of the lower filler levels, with two more that each have a 1⁄2 chance (50%) of being generated; and three hill giants are always generated on the goal level. The larger ones use huge boulders as weapons, hurling them over large distances. All types of giants share a love for men - roasted, boiled, or fried. Their table manners are legendary.
